definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
the palest ink is better than the best memory (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 ji4 xing4 bu4 ru2 lan4 bi3 tou2

definition: (coll.) to learn one's lesson/to have enough brains to learn from one's mistakes

sentences.english: If your memory is poor, develop a system.
sentences.chinese: 如果记性差，就想出一套办法来。

sentences.english: The critic was born with a good memory.
sentences.chinese: 那个评论家生来就记性好。

sentences.english: Memory affects intelligence and good memory raises the effective IQ.
sentences.chinese: 记忆影响着智力，好记性能够有效提升IQ。

sentences.english: Hope has a good memory, gratitude a bad one.
sentences.chinese: 希望有一个好记性，感激则有坏记性。

sentences.english: Hope has a good memory, gratitude a bad one.
sentences.chinese: 希望有一个好记性，感激则有坏记性。

sentences.english: Unless they have a very, very good memory, they will not.
sentences.chinese: 除非他们记性非常好，否则他们答不出来。

sentences.english: I once knew a man whose memory was very bad.
sentences.chinese: 有一次我认识一个人他的记性非常的差。

sentences.english: If I had a good memory, I wouldn't forget people's names all the time.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有个好记性，我就不会老是忘记人们的名字了。

sentences.english: Well, I would never have no memory even I never read the story about wolf is coming.
sentences.chinese: 就算我没读过狼来了的故事，我也不会再不长记性了。

sentences.english: I have a memory like a sieve , so I have to note down everything I heard.
sentences.chinese: 我的记性很坏，听到什么东西就非用笔记下来不可。

sentences.english: The lender has a better memory than the borrower.
My son has a good memory, so he does well in school.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子记性很好，所以他在学校表现优良。

sentences.english: To depend on your memory without studying for a test is to grasp at straws.
sentences.chinese: 应付考试光靠好记性而不用功是枉费心机。

sentences.english: Has been used to my memory difference, had said the words always forgot.
sentences.chinese: 习惯了我的记性差，说过的话老忘记。

sentences.english: Most people confess to a bad memory.
sentences.chinese: 大多数人都承认记性差。

sentences.english: Many complain of their Memory, few of their judgment.
sentences.chinese: 许多人抱怨自己记性不佳，几乎没人说自己判断力差。

definition: see 貴人多忘|贵人多忘[gui4 ren2 duo1 wang4]
erhua variant of 人緣|人缘[ren2 yuan2]
